4901.definition: [συνεπιμαρτυρέω] from {{G4862}} and {{G1957}}; to testify further jointly, i.e. unite in adding evidence

4902.definition: [συνέπομαι] middle voice from {{G4862}} and a primary ἕπω (to follow); to attend (travel) in company with

4903.definition: [συνεργέω] from {{G4904}}; to be a fellow-worker, i.e. co-operate

4904.definition: [συνεργός] from a presumed compound of {{G4862}} and the base of {{G2041}}; a co-laborer, i.e. coadjutor

4905.definition: [συνέρχομαι] from {{G4862}} and {{G2064}}; to convene, depart in company with, associate with, or (specially), cohabit (conjugally)

4906.definition: [συνεσθίω] from {{G4862}} and {{G2068}} (including its alternate); to take food in company with

4907.definition: [σύνεσις] from {{G4920}}; a mental putting together, i.e. intelligence or (concretely) the intellect

4908.definition: [συνετός] from {{G4920}}; mentally put (or putting) together, i.e. sagacious Compare {{G5429}}.

4909.definition: [συνευδοκέω] from {{G4862}} and {{G2106}}; to think well of in common, i.e. assent to, feel gratified with

4910.definition: [συνευωχέω] from {{G4862}} and a derivative of a presumed compound of {{G2095}} and a derivative of {{G2192}} (meaning to be in good condition, i.e. (by implication) to fare well, or feast); to entertain sumptuously in company with, i.e. (middle voice or passive) to revel together

4911.definition: [συνεφίστημι] from {{G4862}} and {{G2186}}; to stand up together, i.e. to resist (or assault) jointly

4912.definition: [συνέχω] from {{G4862}} and {{G2192}}; to hold together, i.e. to compress (the ears, with a crowd or siege) or arrest (a prisoner); figuratively, to compel, perplex, afflict, preoccupy

4913.definition: [συνήδομαι] middle voice from {{G4862}} and the base of {{G2237}}; to rejoice in with oneself, i.e. feel satisfaction concerning

4914.definition: [συνήθεια] from a compound of {{G4862}} and {{G2239}}; mutual habituation, i.e. usage

4915.definition: [συνηλικιώτης] from {{G4862}} and a derivative of {{G2244}}; a co-aged person, i.e. alike in years

4916.definition: [συνθάπτω] from {{G4862}} and {{G2290}}; to inter in company with, i.e. (figuratively) to assimilate spiritually (to Christ by a sepulture as to sin)

4917.definition: [συνθλάω] from {{G4862}} and thlao (to crush); to dash together, i.e. shatter

4918.definition: [συνθλίβω] from {{G4862}} and {{G2346}}; to compress, i.e. crowd on all sides

4919.definition: [συνθρύπτω] from {{G4862}} and θρύπτω (to crumble); to crush together, i.e. (figuratively) to dispirit

4920.definition: [συνίημι] from {{G4862}} and ἵημι (to send); to put together, i.e. (mentally) to comprehend; by implication, to act piously

4921.definition: [συνιστάω] ,   or (strengthened)      συνιστάνω,   or      συνίστημιfrom {{G4862}} and {{G2476}} (including its collateral forms); to set together, i.e. (by implication) to introduce (favorably), or (figuratively) to exhibit; intransitively, to stand near, or (figuratively) to constitute

4922.definition: [συνοδεύω] from {{G4862}} and {{G3593}}; to travel in company with

4923.definition: [συνοδία] from a compound of {{G4862}} and {{G3598}} ("synod"); companionship on a journey, i.e. (by implication), a caravan

4924.definition: [συνοικέω] from {{G4862}} and {{G3611}}; to reside together (as a family)

4925.definition: [συνοικοδομέω] from {{G4862}} and {{G3618}}; to construct, i.e. (passively) to compose (in company with other Christians, figuratively)

4927.definition: [συνομορέω] from {{G4862}} and a derivative of a compound of the base of 3674 and the base of {{G3725}}; to border together, i.e. adjoin

4929.definition: [συντάσσω] from {{G4862}} and {{G5021}}; to arrange jointly, i.e. (figuratively) to direct

4930.definition: [συντέλεια] from {{G4931}}; entire completion, i.e. consummation (of a dispensation)

4931.definition: [συντελέω] from {{G4862}} and {{G5055}}; to complete entirely; generally, to execute (literally or figuratively)

4932.definition: [συντέμνω] from {{G4862}} and the base of {{G5114}}; to contract by cutting, i.e. (figuratively) do concisely (speedily)

4933.definition: [συντηρέω] from {{G4862}} and {{G5083}}; to keep closely together, i.e. (by implication) to conserve (from ruin); mentally, to remember (and obey)

4934.definition: [συντίθεμαι] middle voice from {{G4862}} and {{G5087}}; to place jointly, i.e. (figuratively) to consent (bargain, stipulate), concur

4935.definition: [συντόμως] adverb from a derivative of {{G4932}}; concisely (briefly)

4936.definition: [συντρέχω] from {{G4862}} and {{G5143}} (including its alternate); to rush together (hastily assemble) or headlong (figuratively)

4937.definition: [συντρίβω] from {{G4862}} and the base of {{G5147}}; to crush completely, i.e. to shatter (literally or figuratively)

4938.definition: [σύντριμμα] from {{G4937}}; concussion or utter fracture (properly, concretely), i.e. complete ruin

4939.definition: [σύντροφος] from {{G4862}} and {{G5162}} (in a passive sense); a fellow-nursling, i.e. comrade

4940.definition: [συντυγχάνω] from {{G4862}} and {{G5177}}; to chance together, i.e. meet with (reach)

4941.definition: [Συντύχη] from {{G4940}}; an accident; Syntyche, a Christian female

4942.definition: [συνυποκρίνομαι] from {{G4862}} and {{G5271}}; to act hypocritically in concert with

4943.definition: [συνυπουργέω] from {{G4862}} and a derivative of a compound of {{G5259}} and the base of {{G2041}}; to be a co-auxiliary, i.e. assist

4944.definition: [συνωδίνω] from {{G4862}} and {{G5605}}; to have (parturition) pangs in company (concert, simultaneously) with, i.e. (figuratively) to sympathize (in expectation of relief from suffering)

4945.definition: [συνωμοσία] from a compound of {{G4862}} and {{G3660}}; a swearing together, i.e. (by implication) a plot

4946.definition: [Συράκουσαι] plural of uncertain derivation; Syracuse, the capital of Sicily

4947.definition: [Συρία] probably of Hebrew origin ({{H6865}}); Syria (i.e. Tsyria or Tyre), a region of Asia

4948.definition: [Σύρος] from the same as {{G4947}}; a Syran (i.e. probably Tyrian), a native of Syria

4949.definition: [Συροφοίνισσα] feminine of a compound of {{G4948}} and the same as {{G5403}}; a Syro-phœnician woman, i.e. a female native of Phœnicia in Syria

4950.definition: [σύρτις] from {{G4951}}; a shoal (from the sand drawn thither by the waves), i.e. the Syrtis Major or great bay on the north coast of Africa

4952.definition: [συσπαράσσω] from {{G4862}} and {{G4682}}; to rend completely, i.e. (by analogy) to convulse violently

4953.definition: [σύσσημον] neuter of a compound of {{G4862}} and the base of {{G4591}}; a sign in common, i.e. preconcerted signal

4954.definition: [σύσσωμος] from {{G4862}} and {{G4983}}; of a joint body, i.e. (figuratively) a fellow-member of the Christian community

4955.definition: [συστασιαστής] from a compound of {{G4862}} and a derivative of {{G4714}}; a fellow-insurgent

4956.definition: [συστατικός] from a derivative of {{G4921}}; introductory, i.e. recommendatory

4957.definition: [συσταυρόω] from {{G4862}} and {{G4717}}; to impale in company with (literally or figuratively)

4958.definition: [συστέλλω] from {{G4862}} and {{G4724}}; to send (draw) together, i.e. enwrap (enshroud a corpse for burial), contract (an interval)

4959.definition: [συστενάζω] from {{G4862}} and {{G4727}}; to moan jointly, i.e. (figuratively) experience a common calamity

4960.definition: [συστοιχέω] from {{G4862}} and {{G4748}}; to file together (as soldiers in ranks), i.e. (figuratively) to correspond to

4961.definition: [συστρατιώτης] from {{G4862}} and {{G4757}}; a co-campaigner, i.e. (figuratively) an associate in Christian toil

4962.definition: [συστρέφω] from {{G4862}} and {{G4762}}; to twist together, i.e. collect (a bundle, a crowd)

4963.definition: [συστροφή] from {{G4962}}; a twisting together, i.e. (figuratively) a secret coalition, riotous crowd

4964.definition: [συσχηματίζω] from {{G4862}} and a derivative of {{G4976}}; to fashion alike, i.e. conform to the same pattern (figuratively)

4965.definition: [Συχάρ] of Hebrew origin ({{H7941}}); Sychar (i.e. Shekar), a place in Palestine

4966.definition: [Συχέμ] of Hebrew origin ({{H7927}}); Sychem (i.e. Shekem), the name of a Canaanite and of a place in Palestine

4967.definition: [σφαγή] from {{G4969}}; butchery (of animals for food or sacrifice, or (figuratively) of men (destruction))

4968.definition: [σφάγιον] neuter of a derivative of {{G4967}}; a victim (in sacrifice)

4969.definition: [σφάζω] a primary verb; to butcher (especially an animal for food or in sacrifice) or (generally) to slaughter, or (specially), to maim (violently)

4970.definition: [σφόδρα] neuter plural of σφοδρός (violent; of uncertain derivation) as adverb; vehemently, i.e. in a high degree, much

4971.definition: [σφοδρῶς] adverb from the same as {{G4970}}; very much

4972.definition: [σφραγίζω] from {{G4973}}; to stamp (with a signet or private mark) for security or preservation (literally or figuratively); by implication, to keep secret, to attest

4973.definition: [σφραγίς] probably strengthened from {{G5420}}; a signet (as fencing in or protecting from misappropriation); by implication, the stamp impressed (as a mark of privacy, or genuineness), literally or figuratively

4974.definition: [σφυρόν] neuter of a presumed derivative probably of the same as σφαῖρα (a ball, "sphere"; compare the feminine σφῦρα, a hammer); the ankle (as globular)

4975.definition: [σχεδόν] neuter of a presumed derivative of the alternate of {{G2192}} as adverb; nigh, i.e. nearly

4976.definition: [σχῆμα] from the alternate of {{G2192}}; a figure (as a mode or circumstance), i.e. (by implication) external condition

4977.definition: [σχίζω] apparently a primary verb; to split or sever (literally or figuratively)

4978.definition: [σχίσμα] from {{G4977}}; a split or gap ("schism"), literally or figuratively

4979.definition: [σχοινίον] diminutive of σχοῖνος (a rush or flag-plant; of uncertain derivation); a rushlet, i.e. grass-withe or tie (generally)

4980.definition: [σχολάζω] from {{G4981}}; to take a holiday, i.e. be at leisure for (by implication, devote oneself wholly to); figuratively, to be vacant (of a house)

4981.definition: [σχολή] probably feminine of a presumed derivative of the alternate of {{G2192}}; properly, loitering (as a withholding of oneself from work) or leisure, i.e. (by implication) a "school" (as vacation from physical employment)

4982.definition: [σώζω] from a primary σῶς (contraction for obsolete σάος, "safe"); to save, i.e. deliver or protect (literally or figuratively)

4983.definition: [σῶμα] from {{G4982}}; the body (as a sound whole), used in a very wide application, literally or figuratively

4986.definition: [Σώπατρος] from the base of {{G4982}} and {{G3962}}; of a safe father; Sopatrus, a Christian Compare {{G4989}}.

4987.definition: [σωρεύω] from another form of {{G4673}}; to pile up (literally or figuratively)

4988.definition: [Σωσθένης] from the base of {{G4982}} and that of {{G4599}}; of safe strength; Sosthenes, a Christian

4990.definition: [σωτήρ] from {{G4982}}; a deliverer, i.e. God or Christ

4991.definition: [σωτηρία] feminine of a derivative of {{G4990}} as (properly, abstract) noun; rescue or safety (physically or morally)

4992.definition: [σωτήριον] neuter of the same as {{G4991}} as (properly, concretely) noun; defender or (by implication) defence

4993.definition: [σωφρονέω] from {{G4998}}; to be of sound mind, i.e. sane, (figuratively) moderate

4994.definition: [σωφρονίζω] from {{G4998}}; to make of sound mind, i.e. (figuratively) to discipline or correct

4996.definition: [σωφρόνως] adverb from {{G4998}}; with sound mind, i.e. moderately

4997.definition: [σωφροσύνη] from {{G4998}}; soundness of mind, i.e. (literally) sanity or (figuratively) self-control

4998.definition: [σώφρων] from the base of {{G4982}} and that of {{G5424}}; safe (sound) in mind, i.e. self-controlled (moderate as to opinion or passion)

4999.definition: [Ταβέρναι] plural of Latin origin; huts or wooden-walled buildings; Tabernæ

5000.definition: [Ταβιθά] of Chaldee origin (compare {{H6646}}); the gazelle; Tabitha (i.e. Tabjetha), a Christian female
